sections.title: What is a Touch Sensor?
sections.content: A touch sensor is a simple digital sensor that detects physical contact. In FTC, touch sensors are often used as limit switches or to detect when a mechanism has reached a certain position. Understanding how to use touch sensors is important for building safe and reliable robots.

sections.title: Configuring a Touch Sensor in the Hardware Map
sections.content:
Before you can use a touch sensor in your code, you must add it to your robot's hardware configuration. Assign it a clear, descriptive name.

sections.title: Practical Applications and Safety
sections.content: Touch sensors are commonly used as limit switches to prevent mechanisms from moving too far and causing damage. Always test your sensors and include safety checks in your code.

sections.title: Troubleshooting Tips
sections.content: If your touch sensor is not responding, check your wiring, hardware configuration, and make sure you are using the correct name in your code.
